problem_names: lemma MONO_ant: "MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>A B C. A \<^bold>\<preceq> B \<longrightarrow> \<phi>(B \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C) \<^bold>\<preceq> \<phi>(A \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C)"
lemma MONO_cons: "MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>A B C. A \<^bold>\<preceq> B \<longrightarrow> \<phi>(C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> A) \<^bold>\<preceq> \<phi>(C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> B)"
translations: lemma MONO_ant: "MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>A B C. A \<^bold>\<preceq> B \<longrightarrow> \<phi>(B \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C) \<^bold>\<preceq> \<phi>(A \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow>
    \<forall>A B C.
       B \<^bold>\<succeq> A \<longrightarrow>
       \<phi> (A \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C) \<^bold>\<succeq>
       \<phi> (B \<^bold>\<rightarrow> C)
lemma MONO_cons: "MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>A B C. A \<^bold>\<preceq> B \<longrightarrow> \<phi>(C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> A) \<^bold>\<preceq> \<phi>(C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> B)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. MONO \<phi> \<Longrightarrow>
    \<forall>A B C.
       B \<^bold>\<succeq> A \<longrightarrow>
       \<phi> (C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> B) \<^bold>\<succeq>
       \<phi> (C \<^bold>\<rightarrow> A)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>A.
       \<phi> (\<phi> A) \<^bold>\<succeq> \<phi> A \<Longrightarrow>
    \<forall>A.
       (\<lambda>w.
           \<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> A w) w) \<^bold>\<succeq>
       (\<lambda>w.
           \<not> \<phi>
                   (\<lambda>w.
                       \<not> \<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> A w) w)
                   w)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>A.
       \<phi> A \<^bold>\<succeq> \<phi> (\<phi> A) \<Longrightarrow>
    \<forall>A.
       (\<lambda>w.
           \<not> \<phi>
                   (\<lambda>w.
                       \<not> \<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> A w) w)
                   w) \<^bold>\<succeq>
       (\<lambda>w. \<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> A w) w)
by (metis IDEM_def IDEM_dual1 IDEM_dual2 IDEMa_def IDEMb_def dual_symm)
unfolding dual_def NOR_def dNOR_def top_def bottom_def compl_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>w. \<phi> (\<lambda>w. False) w = False) =
    (\<forall>w. (\<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> True) w) = True)
unfolding dual_def NOR_def dNOR_def top_def bottom_def compl_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>w. \<phi> (\<lambda>w. True) w = True) =
    (\<forall>w. (\<not> \<phi> (\<lambda>w. \<not> False) w) = False)
text\<open>\noindent{Interestingly, EXP and its dual allow for an alternative characterization of fixed-point operators.}\<close>
by (smt id_def EXP_def dual_def dual_symm equal_op_def conn)
text\<open>\noindent{MONO, MULT-a and ADDI-b are equivalent.}\<close>
